error.signature: Error: resource class 'large' is not available on your plan. Upgrade your plan to use this resource class.
error.regex: (?:resource class.*not available|resource_class.*not.*plan|resource class.*not enabled|Cannot find a resource class|unknown resource class)

verdict.summary: CircleCI job requests a resource class (machine size) that is not available on the current plan or not enabled for the organization. Larger resource classes require paid plans or explicit enablement.

dead_ends.action: Use the resource class name from documentation without checking plan availability
dead_ends.why_fails: Resource classes like 'large', 'xlarge', '2xlarge' and ARM resource classes are only available on paid plans; free tier is limited to 'small' and 'medium'

dead_ends.action: Try to use Docker executor resource classes with machine executor or vice versa
dead_ends.why_fails: Resource classes are executor-specific; Docker executor and machine executor have completely different resource class names and availability

workarounds.action: Use a resource class available on your current plan
workarounds.how: Check available resource classes at https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference/#resourceclass. For free plans, use 'small' or 'medium'. Optimize builds to work within available resources

workarounds.action: Upgrade the CircleCI plan or request the resource class to be enabled
workarounds.how: Go to CircleCI Organization Settings > Plan to upgrade. For custom resource classes on dedicated plans, contact CircleCI support to enable them for your organization

leads_to.condition: When using a smaller resource class causes tests to run slower and hit timeouts

preceded_by.condition: When timeout issues prompt upgrading to a larger resource class that is not available

frequently_confused_with.distinction: CircleCI resource class is about machine size availability on the platform; GitLab runner stuck is about runner registration and connectivity
